M.S. Holmes: U. S. Geological Survey (USGS) 7600 Sand Point Way NE, Seattle, Washington 98115, U.S.A.
D.R. Thor: U. S. Geological Survey (USGS) 345 Middlefield Road, Menlo Park, California 94025, U.S.A
citeinfo.title: Distribution of Gas-charged Sediment in Norton Sound and Chirikov Basin, Northeastern Bering Sea

abstract.p: Numerous zones of anomalous acoustic responses caused by gas in the subsurface sediment layers have been detected on seismic reflection records from Norton Sound and Chrikov Basin. Sound sources used range in size and power from 3.5 kHz transducers to 1326 in to the third power (21.71) air gun arrays.
{Reference: Holmes ML, Thor DR (1982) Distribution of gas-charged sediment. in Norton Sound and Chirikov Basin, northeastern Bering Sea. Geol Mijnb 61:79-89.]
This volume may be found at many university libraries.

descript.purpose: To determine the geographic extent and distribution of zones showing anomalous acoustic responses on seismic reflection records from Norton Sound and Chirikov Basin.
